title: SL Green Realty Corp Downgraded by Zacks to “Hold” (SLG)
content:
Zacks downgraded shares of SL Green Realty Corp (NYSE:SLG) from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research note issued to investors on Monday, AnalystRatingsNetwork.com reports. 

According to Zacks, “In a bid to enhance its portfolio in the New York City, recently SL Green announced the acquisition of Eleven Madison Avenue for $2.285 billion. The company reported second-quarter 2015 adjusted funds from operations (“FFO”) of $1.65 per share, comfortably beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.55, aided by a rise in same-store net operating income (“NOI”). In July, the REIT announced the acquisition of two mixed-use properties in Downtown Manhattan. The REIT seeks to acquire top-class assets and divest the non-core ones. Further, it continues to invest in New York City’s premium retail locations. But, stiff competition and an anticipated rise in interest rates keep us concerned.” 

A number of other equities analysts have also recently weighed in on the company. Jefferies Group  restated a buy rating and set a $142.00 target price on shares of SL Green Realty Corp in a report on Saturday, May 23rd. Goldman Sachs lowered SL Green Realty Corp from a neutral rating to a sell rating and reduced their price target for the company from $122.00 to $105.00 in a research report on Monday, July 13th. Barclays raised their target price on SL Green Realty Corp from $123.00 to $124.00 and gave the stock an equal weight rating in a research report on Friday, May 22nd. Evercore ISI  reaffirmed a hold rating and set a $123.00 price target (down previously from $127.00) on shares of SL Green Realty Corp in a research report on Tuesday, June 9th. Finally, SunTrust lowered their target price on SL Green Realty Corp from $142.00 to $129.00 and set a neutral rating on the stock in a research note on Thursday, August 13th. Two analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have issued  a hold rating and three have given a buy rating to the stock. The company currently has a consensus rating of Hold and an average target price of $124.75. 

SL Green Realty Corp ( NYSE:SLG ) opened at 100.95 on Monday. SL Green Realty Corp has a one year low of $99.89 and a one year high of $135.81. The company has a market capitalization of $10.06 billion and a P/E ratio of 78.44. The firm has a 50-day moving average of $111.49 and a 200-day moving average of $119.70. 

SL Green Realty Corp (NYSE:SLG) last released its quarterly earnings results on Wednesday, July 22nd. The real estate investment trust reported $1.62 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the analysts’ consensus estimate of $1.56 by $0.06. During the same quarter in the prior year, the company posted $1.62 earnings per share. The business had revenue of $345.63 million for the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $310.72 million. The business’s revenue for the quarter was up 8.6% compared to the same quarter last year.  On average, analysts anticipate that  SL Green Realty Corp will post $6.33 earnings per share for the current year. 

SL Green Realty Corp. is a self-managed real estate investment trust, or REIT, with in house capabilities in property management, acquisitions and dispositions, financing, development and redevelopment, building and leasing. It runs two segments: preferred equity investments and debt and real estate. The Organization owns interests chiefly in midtown Manhattan. The Company also manages an around 336,201 square foot office building owned by a third party and held debt and preferred equity investments with a book value of around $1.4 billion. The Organization also invests in well-collateralized debt and preferred equity investments.
